protocol.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a system of rules about the correct way to behave on an official occasion
protocol.translation[0].definitions[1].d: an international agreement between two or more countries
protocol.translation[0].definitions[1].e: the Montreal Protocol on the protection of the ozone layer
protocol.translation[0].definitions[2].d: a written record of a formal or international agreement, or an early form of an agreement
protocol.translation[0].definitions[3].d: an established method for connecting computers so that they can exchange information
protocol.translation[0].definitions[4].d: a set of rules that are followed when doing a scientific experiment or giving someone medical treatment
protocol.translation[1].definitions[0].d: an established method for connecting computers so that they can exchange information
protocol.translation[1].definitions[0].e: You have to use a different protocol with this new modem.
protocol.translation[1].definitions[1].d: the system of rules on the correct and acceptable way to behave on official occasions
protocol.translation[1].definitions[1].e: Protocol demands that we meet the company chairman at the airport.
a breach of  (=failure to follow) diplomatic protocol
